---
title: "Elementary"
sidebarTitle: "Introduction"
description: "dbt native data observability"
icon: "fire"
---

Monitor your data pipelines in minutes, in your dbt project. Gain immediate visibility, detect data issues, send actionable alerts, and understand impact and root cause.

<div className="dark:#4A165C rounded-md p-0">
  <img
    src="https://res.cloudinary.com/diuctyblm/image/upload/v1699193505/mintlify_header_eqa3jy.png"
    alt="Elementary banner"
  />
</div>

## Quick start

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card
    title="Elementary Cloud"
    icon="cloud"
    iconType="solid"
    href="quickstart"
  >
    <br />
    Fully managed data observability solution with premium features.
    <br />
    Integrations:
    <img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/diuctyblm/image/upload/v1699269702/cloud_integrations_4_qlaycc.png" />
  </Card>
  <Card
    title="Elementary OSS"
    icon="square-terminal"
    iconType="solid"
    href="quickstart-cli-package"
  >
    <br />
    Deploy, orchestrate and self-host Elementary CLI in your environment.
    <br />
    Integrations:
    <img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/diuctyblm/image/upload/v1699269702/cli_integrations_4_bach1a.png" />
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## Key features

<CardGroup cols={1}>
  <Card title="Data anomaly detection" icon="monitor-waveform" iconType="solid">
    Monitor data quality metrics, freshness, volume and schema changes.
  </Card>
  <Card
    title="dbt artifacts, run results and model performance"
    icon="table-tree"
    iconType="regular"
  >
    Upload metadata, run and test results to tables as part of your jobs.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Slack alerts" icon="slack" iconType="regular">
    Send informative alerts to different channels and users.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Data observability dashboard" icon="browsers" iconType="solid">
    Inspect your data health overview, test results, models performance and data
    lineage.
  </Card>

  >
    Explore and discover data sets, manage your documentation in code.
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## How it works?

In your dbt project, you install the [Elementary dbt package](/quickstart#install-the-dbt-package).
The package will collect metadata and run results to a dedicated Elementary schema.
You can use elementary tests in your dbt project, configured just like native dbt tests.

[Elementary Cloud](/cloud/introduction) or [Elementary CLI](/understand-elementary/cli-install#install-and-configure) will connect to your data warehouse, read from the Elementary schema, and present the results in the UI / alerts.

## Community & Support

For additional information and help, you can use one of these channels:

- [Slack](https://elementary-data.com/community) (live chat with the team, support, consult with us, etc.)
- [GitHub issues](https://github.com/elementary-data/elementary-lineage/issues) (bug reports, feature requests, contributions)
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ElementaryData) (updates on new releases and stuff)

## Contributing to Elementary

Thank you 🧡 Whether it’s a bug fix, new feature, or documentation changes - we greatly appreciate contributions!

Check out the [contributions guide](/general/contributions).
